New Records: Anthony Edwards broke Kevin Garnett's record for most consecutive 20+ point games to start a season in @Timberwolves history (11 in 2000)
Key Match Events: The Minnesota Timberwolves lost to the Portland Trail Blazers by a score of 106-98
Post-Match Reflections: The Timberwolves are in the middle of a three-game losing streak
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Timberwolves are 6-6 in their first 12 games, which has them as the 11th seed in the Western Conference
The Trail Blazers improved to 5-8 in 13 games, which has them as the 13th seed in the Western Conference
Others: Anthony Edwards finished the loss with 24 points, four rebounds, four assists, four steals and one block while shooting 10/25 from the field and 0/9 from the three-point range in 40 minutes of playing time

Edwards is off to a strong start to the 2024-25 season with averages of 28.1 points, 5.3 rebounds, 3.7 assists and 1.0 steals per contest while shooting 46.9% from the field and 45.3% from the three-point range in 12 games
